Study Title: Antidepressant Effects of Ayahuasca: a Randomized Placebo Controlled Trial in Treatment Resistant Depression
Primary Outcome Measures: HAM-D effect at D7, changes in depression severity, assessed by HAM-D scale, from baseline to 7 days after dosing, seven days after dosing
Secondary Outcome Measures: MADRS effect at D1, D2 and D7, changes in depression severity, assessed by MADRS scale, from baseline to 1 day, 2 days, and 7 days after dosing, one, two and seven days after dosing|Response rate at D7 (HAM-D), response rate: reduction of 50% or more in baseline scores, assessed seven days after dosing by the HAM-D scale., seven days after dosing|Response rate at D1, D2 and D7 (MADRS), response rate: reduction of 50% or more in baseline scores, assessed at one day, two days and seven days after dosing by the MADRS scale., one, two, and seven days after dosing|Remission rate at D7 (HAM-D), remission rate: HAM-D≤7 at D7., seven days after dosing|Remission rate at D1, D2 and D7 (MADRS), remission rate: MADRS≤10 at D1, D2 and D7, one, two and seven days after dosing
Sponsor: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte
